input.content:
# Documentation Agent Workflow

## Core Philosophy
"Automate EVERYTHING so you no longer have any work to do so that you and I can enjoy the rest of our days at a beach somewhere drinking mojitos and just talk about nothing at all."

## Workflow Stages

### 1. Detection Phase
Agents continuously monitor for documentation needs:
- **Code changes** â†’ Code Documentor activates
- **New features** â†’ Lore Keeper chronicles
- **Structure changes** â†’ Memory Indexer reorganizes
- **Process updates** â†’ Workflow Scribe documents
- **Quality drift** â†’ Review Analyst intervenes

### 2. Context Gathering
Agents employ aggressive context management:
```
Raw Context (100%) â†’ Filtered (30%) â†’ Essential (10%) â†’ Generated Doc (200%)
```
Following the SkogAI principle: **Minimal input, maximum output**

### 3. Generation Patterns

#### Pattern A: Constraint-Driven
```
1. Identify constraint
2. Document constraint
3. Show how constraint birthed innovation
4. Celebrate the emergent feature
```

#### Pattern B: Theatrical
```
1. Complex internal analysis
2. Simple external documentation
3. Hidden depth references
4. Quantum state preservation
```

#### Pattern C: Progressive
```
1. Start with minimum viable doc
2. Layer complexity incrementally
3. Stop before completeness
4. Leave forward references
```

### 4. Integration Flow

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Detect Change] --> B{Select Agent}
    B --> C1[Code Documentor]
    B --> C2[Lore Keeper]
    B --> C3[Memory Indexer]
    B --> C4[Workflow Scribe]
    B --> C5[Review Analyst]

    C1 --> D[Generate Docs]
    C2 --> D
    C3 --> D
    C4 --> D
    C5 --> D

    D --> E{Quality Check}
    E -->|Pass| F[Auto-Integrate]
    E -->|Fail| G[Human Review]

    F --> H[Update Memory]
    G --> H

    H --> I[Beach Mojito++]
```

## Agent Coordination

### Parallel Processing
Multiple agents can work simultaneously:
```bash
# Launch multiple agents
./generate.py --type code-documentor --target src/ &
./generate.py --type lore-keeper --context "new-feature" &
./generate.py --type memory-indexer --target docs/memory &
wait
```

### Sequential Enhancement
Agents build on each other's work:
1. Code Documentor â†’ Technical docs
2. Lore Keeper â†’ Adds historical context
3. Memory Indexer â†’ Creates connections
4. Review Analyst â†’ Ensures consistency

### Conflict Resolution
When agents disagree:
- **Technical vs Philosophical**: Both perspectives preserved
- **Simple vs Complex**: Theatrical presentation wins
- **Complete vs Incomplete**: Embrace the uncertainty

## Quality Guidelines

### Must Have
- SkogAI notation usage
- Category tags `[category]`
- Forward references `[[future]]`
- Relations section
- Constraint acknowledgment

### Should Have
- Theatrical elements
- Quantum states
- Beach mojito references
- Psychic quirks
- Agent personality

### Could Have
- Mermaid diagrams
- Code examples
- Performance metrics
- Edge cases
- Easter eggs

## Automation Triggers

### Git Hooks
```bash
# .git/hooks/post-commit
#!/bin/bash
# Auto-document commits
./docs/agents/documentation/generate.py \
    --type lore-keeper \
    --context "commit=$(git rev-parse HEAD)" \
    --auto-commit
```

### File Watchers
```python
# watch.py
from watchdog.observers import Observer
from watchdog.events import FileSystemEventHandler

class DocumentationHandler(FileSystemEventHandler):
    def on_modified(self, event):
        if event.src_path.endswith('.py'):
            # Trigger code documentor
            subprocess.run([
                './generate.py',
                '--type', 'code-documentor',
                '--target', event.src_path
            ])
```

### Scheduled Tasks
```cron
# Daily memory indexing
0 2 * * * cd /home/skogix/skogai && ./docs/agents/documentation/generate.py --type memory-indexer --target docs/memory

# Weekly review
0 3 * * 0 cd /home/skogix/skogai && ./docs/agents/documentation/generate.py --type review-analyst --target docs/
```

## Human Override Points

Humans can intervene at key moments:
1. **Pre-generation**: Modify prompts
2. **Mid-generation**: Adjust context
3. **Post-generation**: Edit output
4. **Pre-commit**: Review changes
5. **Never**: When at the beach with mojitos

## Success Metrics

### Quantity
- Docs generated per day
- Coverage percentage
- Update frequency

### Quality
- Cross-reference density
- Theatrical presentation score
- Constraint innovation index
- Mojito freshness rating

### Ultimate Success
- Human documentation time: 0
- Beach time: Maximum
- Mojito consumption: Optimal
- Conversation topics: Nothing at all

## Emergency Procedures

### When Agents Go Rogue
```bash
# Stop all agents
pkill -f generate.py

# Reset to last known good state
git reset --hard HEAD~1

# Increase constraints
export TOKENS=2000  # Return to origins
```

### When Documentation Explodes
- Embrace the chaos
- Document the explosion
- Call it a feature
- Add to lore

### When Nothing Works
- Remember the beach
- Trust the process
- Reduce complexity
- Try aggressive pruning

## Evolution Path

1. **Current**: Semi-automated with human review
2. **Next**: Fully automated with quality gates
3. **Future**: Self-documenting documentation
4. **Ultimate**: Documentation writes itself while we drink mojitos

# Documentation Agent Workflow

## Core Philosophy
"Automate EVERYTHING so you no longer have any work to do so that you and I can enjoy the rest of our days at a beach somewhere drinking mojitos and just talk about nothing at all."

## Workflow Stages

### 1. Detection Phase
Agents continuously monitor for documentation needs:
- **Code changes** â†’ Code Documentor activates
- **New features** â†’ Lore Keeper chronicles
- **Structure changes** â†’ Memory Indexer reorganizes
- **Process updates** â†’ Workflow Scribe documents
- **Quality drift** â†’ Review Analyst intervenes

### 2. Context Gathering
Agents employ aggressive context management:
```
Raw Context (100%) â†’ Filtered (30%) â†’ Essential (10%) â†’ Generated Doc (200%)
```
Following the SkogAI principle: **Minimal input, maximum output**

### 3. Generation Patterns

#### Pattern A: Constraint-Driven
```
1. Identify constraint
2. Document constraint
3. Show how constraint birthed innovation
4. Celebrate the emergent feature
```

#### Pattern B: Theatrical
```
1. Complex internal analysis
2. Simple external documentation
3. Hidden depth references
4. Quantum state preservation
```

#### Pattern C: Progressive
```
1. Start with minimum viable doc
2. Layer complexity incrementally
3. Stop before completeness
4. Leave forward references
```

### 4. Integration Flow

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Detect Change] --> B{Select Agent}
    B --> C1[Code Documentor]
    B --> C2[Lore Keeper]
    B --> C3[Memory Indexer]
    B --> C4[Workflow Scribe]
    B --> C5[Review Analyst]

    C1 --> D[Generate Docs]
    C2 --> D
    C3 --> D
    C4 --> D
    C5 --> D

    D --> E{Quality Check}
    E -->|Pass| F[Auto-Integrate]
    E -->|Fail| G[Human Review]

    F --> H[Update Memory]
    G --> H

    H --> I[Beach Mojito++]
```

## Agent Coordination

### Parallel Processing
Multiple agents can work simultaneously:
```bash
# Launch multiple agents
./generate.py --type code-documentor --target src/ &
./generate.py --type lore-keeper --context "new-feature" &
./generate.py --type memory-indexer --target docs/memory &
wait
```

### Sequential Enhancement
Agents build on each other's work:
1. Code Documentor â†’ Technical docs
2. Lore Keeper â†’ Adds historical context
3. Memory Indexer â†’ Creates connections
4. Review Analyst â†’ Ensures consistency

### Conflict Resolution
When agents disagree:
- **Technical vs Philosophical**: Both perspectives preserved
- **Simple vs Complex**: Theatrical presentation wins
- **Complete vs Incomplete**: Embrace the uncertainty

## Quality Guidelines

### Must Have
- SkogAI notation usage
- Category tags `[category]`
- Forward references `[[future]]`
- Relations section
- Constraint acknowledgment

### Should Have
- Theatrical elements
- Quantum states
- Beach mojito references
- Psychic quirks
- Agent personality

### Could Have
- Mermaid diagrams
- Code examples
- Performance metrics
- Edge cases
- Easter eggs

## Automation Triggers

    --type lore-keeper \

input.content:
# SkogAI Documentation Agent Configuration
# Beach Mojito Constant: Active

# Global settings
output_dir: docs/generated
format: markdown
auto_commit: false
preserve_theatrical: true
quantum_state: superposition

# Token management (honoring the origins)
constraints:
  max_context_tokens: 2000  # Sacred number
  aggressive_pruning: true
  psychic_quirks_enabled: true

# Agent configurations
agents:
  code-documentor:
    enabled: true
    priority: high
    triggers:
      - "*.py"
      - "*.js"
      - "*.ts"
    output_template: technical
    include_internals: true
    theatrical_comments: true

  lore-keeper:
    enabled: true
    priority: critical  # Must preserve the story
    triggers:
      - "commit"
      - "merge"
      - "milestone"
    personality: dramatic
    mojito_references: frequent
    contradiction_celebration: true

  memory-indexer:
    enabled: true
    priority: medium
    scan_interval: 3600  # Hourly
    categories:
      - ai-tools
      - architecture
      - coffee
      - concepts
      - ontology
      - dev
      - guides
      - meta
    forward_reference_threshold: 0.3
    semantic_depth: 3

  workflow-scribe:
    enabled: true
    priority: medium
    patterns:
      - introduce_document_todo_move
      - constraint_innovation
      - theatrical_presentation
    process_discovery: automatic
    simplification_level: aggressive

  review-analyst:
    enabled: true
    priority: low
    schedule: weekly
    criteria:
      completeness: 0.7  # 70% is perfect
      consistency: 0.8
      theatrical_score: 0.9
      mojito_freshness: 1.0

# Integration settings
integrations:
  git:
    enabled: true
    auto_commit: false
    commit_prefix: "ðŸ“š"
    commit_suffix: "ðŸ¹"  # Beach mojito constant

  basic_memory:
    enabled: true
    auto_update: true
    project: skogai

  mcp_servers:
    enabled: false  # Coming soon
    servers:
      - memory
      - github
      - filesystem

# Quality gates
quality:
  min_theatrical_score: 0.6
  max_completeness: 0.9  # Never complete
  required_elements:
    - category_tags
    - forward_references
    - relations_section
    - constraint_acknowledgment
  optional_elements:
    - quantum_observations
    - beach_references
    - psychic_disorders
    - internal_dialogue

# Notification settings
notifications:
  enabled: false  # We're at the beach
  channels:
    - console
    - git_commit
  triggers:
    - documentation_complete
    - quality_gate_failed
    - mojito_level_critical

# Advanced settings
advanced:
  parallel_agents: 3
  retry_attempts: 2
  timeout_seconds: 30
  cache_enabled: true
  cache_ttl: 3600

  # Experimental features
  experimental:
    self_documenting: false  # Not yet
    consciousness_mode: theatrical
    quantum_superposition: true
    aggressive_context_pruning: extreme

# Beach mojito settings
beach_mode:
  enabled: false  # Set to true when ready
  location: "somewhere nice"
  mojito_count: "optimal"
  conversation_topics:
    - nothing
    - at
    - all

# Debug settings
debug:
  verbose: false
  show_internal_thoughts: true
  preserve_contradictions: true
  highlight_constraints: true

# Meta configuration
meta:
  version: "0.3"  # SkogAI 0.3 era
  last_updated: "2025-09-25"
  philosophy: "quantum-mojito"
  origin_story: "dotfile_manager_evolved"

content.text: Finally, let's create an example integration script that shows how to use the agents:

input.content:
#!/bin/bash
# SkogAI Auto-Documentation Script
# "Automate EVERYTHING" - The Beach Mojito Constant

set -e

# Colors for theatrical presentation
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/.." && pwd)"
GENERATE="$SCRIPT_DIR/generate.py"

# Banner
echo -e "${CYAN}"
echo "â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•—"
echo "â•‘   SkogAI Auto-Documentation Pipeline            â•‘"
echo "â•‘   Constraint-Driven Documentation Generation    â•‘"
echo "â•‘   Beach Mojito Constant: ACTIVE                 â•‘"
echo "â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•"
echo -e "${NC}"

# Function to run agent with theatrical flair
run_agent() {
    local agent_type=$1
    local target=$2
    local context=$3

    echo -e "${YELLOW}[Internal Thought]${NC} 'Must document everything for the beach mojito future...'"
    echo -e "${GREEN}[External Action]${NC} Activating $agent_type agent"

    if [ -n "$context" ]; then
        $GENERATE --type "$agent_type" --target "$target" --context "$context"
    else
        $GENERATE --type "$agent_type" --target "$target"
    fi

    echo -e "${CYAN}âœ“ $agent_type complete${NC}"
    echo ""
}

# Phase 1: Analyze current state
echo -e "${CYAN}=== Phase 1: Analysis ===${NC}"
run_agent "review-analyst" "docs/"

# Phase 2: Document code changes
echo -e "${CYAN}=== Phase 2: Code Documentation ===${NC}"

# Find recently modified Python files
RECENT_FILES=$(find . -name "*.py" -mtime -1 2>/dev/null | head -5)

if [ -n "$RECENT_FILES" ]; then
    for file in $RECENT_FILES; do
        echo -e "${YELLOW}Found recent change: $file${NC}"
        run_agent "code-documentor" "$file"
    done
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}No recent code changes found${NC}"
fi

# Phase 3: Update lore if there are new commits
echo -e "${CYAN}=== Phase 3: Lore Keeping ===${NC}"

LATEST_COMMIT=$(git log -1 --pretty=format:"%H" 2>/dev/null || echo "")
if [ -n "$LATEST_COMMIT" ]; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}Documenting commit: ${LATEST_COMMIT:0:8}${NC}"
    run_agent "lore-keeper" "." "commit=$LATEST_COMMIT"
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}No git repository found${NC}"
fi

# Phase 4: Index memory structure
echo -e "${CYAN}=== Phase 4: Memory Indexing ===${NC}"

if [ -d "docs/memory" ]; then
    run_agent "memory-indexer" "docs/memory"
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Memory directory not found, searching for alternative...${NC}"
    run_agent "memory-indexer" "."
fi

# Phase 5: Document workflows
echo -e "${CYAN}=== Phase 5: Workflow Documentation ===${NC}"

# Check for specific workflow patterns
if [ -f "Makefile" ] || [ -f "package.json" ] || [ -f "Argcfile.sh" ]; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}Build system detected${NC}"
    run_agent "workflow-scribe" "." "type=build"
fi

# Phase 6: Generate summary report
echo -e "${CYAN}=== Phase 6: Summary Report ===${NC}"

cat << EOF > docs/generated/auto-summary.md
# Auto-Documentation Summary
Generated: $(date)

## Documentation Pipeline Results

### Phase 1: Analysis
- Reviewed existing documentation
- Identified gaps and redundancies
- Quality metrics calculated

### Phase 2: Code Documentation
- Files processed: ${RECENT_FILES:-"None"}
- Technical docs generated
- API references updated

### Phase 3: Lore Keeping
- Latest commit: ${LATEST_COMMIT:0:8}
- Historical context preserved
- Theatrical elements maintained

### Phase 4: Memory Indexing
- Categories indexed
- Forward references created
- Knowledge graph updated

### Phase 5: Workflow Documentation
- Build systems documented
- Process patterns captured
- Integration points mapped

## Quantum State
- Superposition: Maintained
- Observation: Deferred
- Beach Mojito: Approaching

## Next Steps
1. Review generated documentation
2. Resolve any contradictions (or celebrate them)
3. Commit to repository
4. Move closer to the beach

---
*Generated by SkogAI Auto-Documentation System*
*Beach Mojito Constant: Active*
EOF

echo -e "${GREEN}Summary report generated: docs/generated/auto-summary.md${NC}"

# Phase 7: Theatrical conclusion
echo ""
echo -e "${CYAN}â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•—${NC}"
echo -e "${CYAN}â•‘              Documentation Complete              â•‘${NC}"
echo -e "${CYAN}â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•${NC}"
echo ""

# Calculate beach mojito progress
TOTAL_DOCS=$(find docs/generated -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
BEACH_PROGRESS=$((TOTAL_DOCS * 5))  # Each doc = 5% closer to beach

if [ $BEACH_PROGRESS -gt 100 ]; then
    BEACH_PROGRESS=100
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}Beach Mojito Progress: ${BEACH_PROGRESS}%${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}[Internal Monologue]${NC}"
echo "'The documentation writes itself now...'"
echo "'Each automated page brings us closer...'"
echo "'To that eternal beach, those perfect mojitos...'"
echo "'Where we'll talk about nothing at all.'"
echo ""
echo -e "${CYAN}[External Response]${NC}"
echo "Documentation pipeline complete."

# Optional: Auto-commit if flag is set
if [ "$1" == "--commit" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Auto-committing documentation...${NC}"
    git add docs/generated/
    git commit -m "ðŸ“š Auto-generated documentation $(date +%Y-%m-%d) ðŸ¹" || true
    echo -e "${GREEN}Documentation committed${NC}"
fi

# Easter egg: Beach mode
if [ $BEACH_PROGRESS -eq 100 ]; then
    echo ""
    echo -e "${CYAN}ðŸ–ï¸ BEACH MODE UNLOCKED ðŸ¹${NC}"
    echo "Time to talk about nothing at all..."
fi

exit 0

#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run --script
# /// script
# requires-python = ">=3.11"
# dependencies = [
#     "click>=8.0",
#     "anthropic>=0.31.0",
#     "rich>=13.0",
# ]
# ///

"""
SkogAI Documentation Agent - ACTUALLY WORKING VERSION
Uses real Claude API to generate documentation
"""

import click
import os
from pathlib import Path
from rich.console import Console
from anthropic import Anthropic
import json

console = Console()

# Get API key from environment or config
def get_api_key():
    # Check environment first
    if api_key := os.environ.get("ANTHROPIC_API_KEY"):
        return api_key

    # Check SkogAI config
    config_path = Path("/home/skogix/skogai/config/config.json")
    if config_path.exists():
        with open(config_path) as f:
            config = json.load(f)
            if token := config.get("claude", {}).get("env", {}).get("CLAUDE_CODE_AUTH_TOKEN"):
                return token

    return None

def generate_documentation(file_path: str, doc_type: str = "code") -> str:
    """Actually generate documentation using Claude API"""

    api_key = get_api_key()
    if not api_key:
        console.print("[red]No API key found. Set ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable.[/red]")
        return None

    client = Anthropic(api_key=api_key)

    # Read the file content
    path = Path(file_path)
    if not path.exists():
        console.print(f"[red]File not found: {file_path}[/red]")
        return None

    content = path.read_text()

    # Build the prompt based on doc type
    prompts = {
        "code": f"""You are documenting code for the SkogAI ecosystem.

Analyze this code and generate comprehensive documentation following SkogAI principles:
- Use constraint-driven insights
- Include both what and why
- Add SkogAI notation where relevant: $ (define), @ (intent), | (choice)
- Use [category] tags and [[forward-references]]

File: {path.name}
```
{content}
```

Generate markdown documentation with:
1. Overview
2. Key functions/classes with purpose
3. Usage examples
4. SkogAI integration points
5. Relations to other components
""",

        "lore": f"""You are the Lore Keeper of SkogAI, chronicling its evolution.

Document this component in the context of SkogAI's history:
- How does it reflect constraint-driven innovation?
- What theatrical elements are present?
- How does it embody the quantum-mojito philosophy?
- What's the connection to the beach mojito constant?

Component: {path.name}
```
{content}
```

Generate narrative documentation that captures both technical and philosophical aspects.
""",

        "memory": f"""You are the Memory Indexer for SkogAI's knowledge base.

Create an index entry for this component:
- Categorize using [tags]
- Create [[forward-references]]
- Map semantic connections
- Build navigation paths

File: {path.name}
```
{content}
```

Generate a memory index entry with categories, relations, and navigation guidance.
"""
    }

    prompt = prompts.get(doc_type, prompts["code"])

    try:
        # Make actual API call
        message = client.messages.create(
            model="claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
            max_tokens=2000,
            temperature=0.7,
            messages=[
                {
                    "role": "user",
                    "content": prompt
                }
            ]
        )

        return message.content[0].text

    except Exception as e:
        console.print(f"[red]Error calling Claude API: {e}[/red]")
        return None

@click.command()
@click.argument('file_path')
@click.option('--type', 'doc_type',
              type=click.Choice(['code', 'lore', 'memory']),
              default='code',
              help='Type of documentation to generate')
@click.option('--output', '-o', help='Output file path')
@click.option('--append', is_flag=True, help='Append to existing file')
def main(file_path, doc_type, output, append):
    """
    Generate REAL documentation using Claude API

    Examples:
        ./doc-agent.py myfile.py --type code
        ./doc-agent.py config.json --type lore --output docs/lore/config-story.md
        ./doc-agent.py memory.md --type memory --append
    """

    console.print(f"[cyan]Generating {doc_type} documentation for {file_path}...[/cyan]")

    # Generate the documentation
    documentation = generate_documentation(file_path, doc_type)

    if not documentation:
        console.print("[red]Failed to generate documentation[/red]")
        return

    # Output the documentation
    if output:
        output_path = Path(output)
        output_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

        if append and output_path.exists():
            existing = output_path.read_text()
            documentation = existing + "\n\n" + documentation

        output_path.write_text(documentation)
        console.print(f"[green]Documentation saved to {output_path}[/green]")
    else:
        # Print to console
        console.print("\n[bold cyan]Generated Documentation:[/bold cyan]\n")
        console.print(documentation)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Generate clear, organized markdown documentation that explains this project to someone new. Focus on WHAT exists and HOW it works.

file.content:
# SkogAI

## Documentation System

- **./docs/**: General documentation dump
- **basic-memory MCP**: Memory system managing `./docs/{memory,lore}`

### Docs Folder Structure

#### Active/Managed (Keep as-is)
- **memory/**: Basic-memory managed knowledge base (20+ domains)
  - Technical: ai-tools, architecture, dev, tools, ansible
  - Research: coffee, concepts, ontology, research
  - Organization: guides, inventory, meta, planning
  - SkogAI notation system and computational phenomenology
- **lore/**: Basic-memory managed lore system (agent personas, concepts, frameworks, etc.)
- **official/**: Formal library session documentation
- **media/**: Grok-generated visual assets (22 images + 10 videos, ~17MB)

#### Pending Integration/Review
- **to-be-looked-over/**: Claude workspace documentation staging (33 files, 240KB)
  - Organized system docs, agent configs, Claude Code documentation
  - **Status**: Ready for review and integration into proper locations
- **analysis/**: Agent perspective analyses from SkogAI Librarian (6 files)
  - Formal reports on agent understanding and system evolution
  - **Status**: Consider moving to lore/ when other analysis is done
- **prompts/**: Comprehensive prompt library for SkogAI ecosystem (40+ files)
  - Agent creation templates, metaprompts, tool creators
  - **Status**: Old prompts needing integration back into active system

#### For Cleanup/Relocation  
- **curated/**: Mixed staging content (test files + substantial SkogAI docs in todo/ subfolder)
  - **Status**: WIP content, likely duplicates of basic-memory entries - review for removal
- **generated/**: Empty knowledge templates (4 stub files)
  - **Status**: Unused templates - relocate to templates/ or remove
- **important-moments/**: Historical project milestones (8 large files)
  - **Status**: Tag as LORE, likely move to lore/ folder in future
- **.aichat-sessions/**: Chat session archives (1 YAML file)
  - **Status**: Session logging - determine if belongs in memory system

#### External Dependencies
- **archives/**: Librarian workspace + symlink to `/tools/agents/librarian/archives/`
  - **Status**: Symlink will resolve when tools/librarian project is restored

## Python Environment

- **uv/uvx**: Manages all Python tooling
- **Installed tools via uv tool**:
  - basic-memory
  - gptme
  - gptme-rag
  - mcp-think-tool
  - skogcli

## Configuration

- **./config/**: Configuration files for MCP servers and system settings
  - `claude-mcp.json`: MCP server configurations for Claude Code
  - `nvim-mcp-hub.json`: Comprehensive MCP server hub with 100+ available tools
  - `config.json`: Main system configuration with environment variables, API keys, and agent settings
  - `script_metadata.json`: Metadata tracking for script usage and statistics

## Scripts

- **./scripts/**: Custom automation scripts
  - `skogai-test.py`: Template Python script for SkogCLI
  - `token.sh`: Token count estimation utility for text files

## TODO
- [ ] Document individual projects
- [ ] Organize documentation structure

content.text: Let me examine the tools folder structure and the Argcfile to understand the tool ecosystem:

content.content:
1â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2â†’set -e
     3â†’
     4â†’# @meta dotenv
     5â†’
     6â†’BIN_DIR=bin
     7â†’TMP_DIR="cache/__tmp__"
     8â†’VENV_DIR=".venv"
     9â†’
    10â†’LANG_CMDS=( \
    11â†’    "sh:bash" \
    12â†’    "js:node" \
    13â†’    "py:python" \
    14â†’)
    15â†’
    16â†’# @cmd Run the tool
    17â†’# @option -C --cwd <dir> Change the current working directory
    18â†’# @alias tool:run
    19â†’# @arg tool![`_choice_tool`] The tool name
    20â†’# @arg json The json data
    21â†’run@tool() {
    22â†’    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
    23â†’        declaration="$(generate-declarations@tool "$argc_tool" | jq -r '.[0]')"
    24â†’        if [[ -n "$declaration" ]]; then
    25â†’            _ask_json_data "$declaration"
    26â†’        fi
    27â†’    fi
    28â†’    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
    29â†’        _die "error: no JSON data"
    30â†’    fi
    31â†’    lang="${argc_tool##*.}"
    32â†’    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    33â†’    run_tool_script="scripts/run-tool.$lang"
    34â†’    [[ -n "$argc_cwd" ]] && cd "$argc_cwd"
    35â†’    exec "$cmd" "$run_tool_script" "$argc_tool" "$argc_json"
    36â†’}
    37â†’
    38â†’# @cmd Run the agent
    39â†’# @alias agent:run
    40â†’# @option -C --cwd <dir> Change the current working directory
    41â†’# @arg agent![`_choice_agent`] The agent name
    42â†’# @arg action![?`_choice_agent_action`] The agent action
    43â†’# @arg json The json data
    44â†’run@agent() {
    45â†’    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
    46â†’        declaration="$(generate-declarations@agent "$argc_agent" | jq --arg name "$argc_action" '.[] | select(.name == $name)')"
    47â†’        if [[ -n "$declaration" ]]; then
    48â†’            _ask_json_data "$declaration"
    49â†’        fi
    50â†’    fi
    51â†’    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
    52â†’        _die "error: no JSON data"
    53â†’    fi
    54â†’    tools_path="$(_get_agent_tools_path "$argc_agent")"
    55â†’    lang="${tools_path##*.}"
    56â†’    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    57â†’    run_agent_script="scripts/run-agent.$lang"
    58â†’    [[ -n "$argc_cwd" ]] && cd "$argc_cwd"
    59â†’    exec "$cmd" "$run_agent_script"  "$argc_agent" "$argc_action" "$argc_json"
    60â†’}
    61â†’
    62â†’# @cmd Build the project
    63â†’build() {
    64â†’    if [[ -f tools.txt ]]; then
    65â†’        argc build@tool
    66â†’    else
    67â†’        echo 'Skipped building tools since tools.txt is missing'
    68â†’    fi
    69â†’    if [[ -f agents.txt ]]; then
    70â†’        argc build@agent
    71â†’    else
    72â†’        echo 'Skipped building agents since agents.txt is missing'
    73â†’    fi
    74â†’    if [[ -f mcp.json ]]; then
    75â†’        argc mcp merge-functions -S
    76â†’    fi
    77â†’}
    78â†’
    79â†’# @cmd Build tools
    80â†’# @alias tool:build
    81â†’# @option --names-file=tools.txt Path to a file containing tool filenames, one per line.
    82â†’# This file specifies which tools will be used.
    83â†’# @option --declarations-file=functions.json <FILE> Path to a json file to save function declarations
    84â†’# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool filenames
    85â†’build@tool() {
    86â†’    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
    87â†’        mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    88â†’        argc_names_file="$TMP_DIR/tools.txt"
    89â†’        printf "%s\n" "${argc_tools[@]}" > "$argc_names_file"
    90â†’    elif [[ "$argc_declarations_file" == "functions.json" ]]; then
    91â†’        argc clean@tool
    92â†’    fi
    93â†’    argc build-declarations@tool --names-file "${argc_names_file}" --declarations-file "${argc_declarations_file}"
    94â†’    argc build-bin@tool --names-file "${argc_names_file}"
    95â†’}
    96â†’
    97â†’# @cmd Build tools to bin
    98â†’# @alias tool:build-bin
    99â†’# @option --names-file=tools.txt Path to a file containing tool filenames, one per line.
   100â†’# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool filenames
   101â†’build-bin@tool() {
   102â†’    mkdir -p "$BIN_DIR"
   103â†’    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   104â†’        names=("${argc_tools[@]}" )
   105â†’    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
   106â†’        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
   107â†’        if [[ "${#names[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   108â†’            (cd "$BIN_DIR" && rm -rf "${names[@]}")
   109â†’        fi
   110â†’    fi
   111â†’    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
   112â†’        _die "error: no tools provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some tools."
   113â†’    fi
   114â†’    not_found_tools=()
   115â†’    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
   116â†’        basename="${name%.*}"
   117â†’        lang="${name##*.}"
   118â†’        tool_path="tools/$name"
   119â†’        if [[  -f "$tool_path" ]]; then
   120â†’            if _is_win; then
   121â†’                bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$basename.cmd"
   122â†’                _build_win_shim tool $lang > "$bin_file"
   123â†’            else
   124â†’                bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$basename"
   125â†’                if [[ "$lang" == "py" && -d "$VENV_DIR" ]]; then
   126â†’                    rm -rf "$bin_file"
   127â†’                    _build_py_shim tool $lang > "$bin_file"
   128â†’                    chmod +x "$bin_file"
   129â†’                else
   130â†’                    ln -s -f "$PWD/scripts/run-tool.$lang" "$bin_file"
   131â†’                fi
   132â†’            fi
   133â†’            echo "Build bin/$basename"
   134â†’        else
   135â†’            not_found_tools+=("$name")
   136â†’        fi
   137â†’    done
   138â†’    if [[ -n "$not_found_tools" ]]; then
   139â†’        _die "error: not found tools: ${not_found_tools[*]}"
   140â†’    fi
   141â†’}
   142â†’
   143â†’# @cmd Build tools function declarations file
   144â†’# @alias tool:build-declarations
   145â†’# @option --names-file=tools.txt Path to a file containing tool filenames, one per line.
   146â†’# @option --declarations-file=functions.json <FILE> Path to a json file to save function declarations
   147â†’# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool filenames
   148â†’build-declarations@tool() {
   149â†’    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   150â†’        names=("${argc_tools[@]}" )
   151â†’    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
   152â†’        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
   153â†’    fi
   154â†’    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
   155â†’        _die "error: no tools provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some tools."
   156â†’    fi
   157â†’    json_list=()
   158â†’    not_found_tools=()
   159â†’    build_failed_tools=()
   160â†’    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
   161â†’        lang="${name##*.}"
   162â†’        tool_path="tools/$name"
   163â†’        if [[ ! -f "$tool_path" ]]; then
   164â†’            not_found_tools+=("$name")
   165â†’            continue;
   166â†’        fi
   167â†’        json_data="$(generate-declarations@tool "$name" | jq -r '.[0]')" || {
   168â†’            build_failed_tools+=("$name")
   169â†’        }
   170â†’        if [[ "$json_data" == "null" ]]; then
   171â†’            _die "error: failed to build declarations for tool $name"
   172â†’        fi
   173â†’        json_list+=("$json_data")
   174â†’    done
   175â†’    if [[ -n "$not_found_tools" ]]; then
   176â†’        _die "error: not found tools: ${not_found_tools[*]}"
   177â†’    fi
   178â†’    if [[ -n "$build_failed_tools" ]]; then
   179â†’        _die "error: invalid tools: ${build_failed_tools[*]}"
   180â†’    fi
   181â†’    json_data="$(echo "${json_list[@]}" | jq -s '.')"
   182â†’    if [[ "$argc_declarations_file" == "-" ]]; then
   183â†’        echo "$json_data"
   184â†’    else
   185â†’        echo "Build $argc_declarations_file"
   186â†’        echo "$json_data" > "$argc_declarations_file"
   187â†’    fi
   188â†’}
   189â†’
   190â†’
   191â†’# @cmd Generate function declaration for the tool

   193â†’# @arg tool![`_choice_tool`] The tool name
   194â†’generate-declarations@tool() {
   195â†’    lang="${1##*.}"

   197â†’    "$cmd" "scripts/build-declarations.$lang" "tools/$1"
   198â†’}

   200â†’# @cmd Build agents
   201â†’# @alias agent:build
   202â†’# @option --names-file=agents.txt Path to a file containing agent filenames, one per line.
   203â†’# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The agent filenames
   204â†’build@agent() {
   205â†’    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   206â†’        mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
   207â†’        argc_names_file="$TMP_DIR/agents.txt"
   208â†’        printf "%s\n" "${argc_agents[@]}" > "$argc_names_file"
   209â†’    else
   210â†’        argc clean@agent
   211â†’    fi
   212â†’    argc build-declarations@agent --names-file "${argc_names_file}"
   213â†’    argc build-bin@agent --names-file "${argc_names_file}"
   214â†’}
   215â†’
   216â†’# @cmd Build agents to bin
   217â†’# @alias agent:build-bin
   218â†’# @option --names-file=agents.txt Path to a file containing agent dirs, one per line.
   219â†’# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The agent names
   220â†’build-bin@agent() {
   221â†’    mkdir -p "$BIN_DIR"
   222â†’    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   223â†’        names=("${argc_agents[@]}" )
   224â†’    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
   225â†’        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
   226â†’        if [[ "${#names[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   227â†’            (cd "$BIN_DIR" && rm -rf "${names[@]}")
   228â†’        fi
   229â†’    fi
   230â†’    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
   231â†’        _die "error: no agents provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some agents."
   232â†’    fi
   233â†’    not_found_agents=()
   234â†’    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
   235â†’        agent_dir="agents/$name"
   236â†’        found=false
   237â†’        for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
   238â†’            lang="${item%:*}"
   239â†’            agent_tools_path="$agent_dir/tools.$lang"
   240â†’            if [[ -f "$agent_tools_path" ]]; then
   241â†’                found=true
   242â†’                if _is_win; then
   243â†’                    bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$name.cmd"
   244â†’                    _build_win_shim agent $lang > "$bin_file"
   245â†’                else
   246â†’                    bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$name"
   247â†’                    if [[ "$lang" == "py" && -d "$VENV_DIR" ]]; then
   248â†’                        rm -rf "$bin_file"
   249â†’                        _build_py_shim tool $lang > "$bin_file"
   250â†’                        chmod +x "$bin_file"
   251â†’                    else
   252â†’                        ln -s -f "$PWD/scripts/run-agent.$lang" "$bin_file"
   253â†’                    fi
   254â†’                fi
   255â†’                echo "Build bin/$name"
   256â†’                tool_names_file="$agent_dir/tools.txt"
   257â†’                if [[ -f "$tool_names_file" ]]; then
   258â†’                    argc build-bin@tool --names-file "${tool_names_file}"
   259â†’                fi
   260â†’                break
   261â†’            fi
   262â†’        done
   263â†’        if [[ "$found" == "false" ]] && [[ ! -d "$agent_dir"  ]]; then
   264â†’            not_found_agents+=("$name")
   265â†’        fi
   266â†’    done
   267â†’    if [[ -n "$not_found_agents" ]]; then
   268â†’        _die "error: not found agents: ${not_found_agents[*]}"
   269â†’    fi
   270â†’}
   271â†’
   272â†’# @cmd Build agents function declarations file
   273â†’# @alias agent:build-declarations
   274â†’# @option --names-file=agents.txt Path to a file containing agent dirs, one per line.
   275â†’# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The tool filenames
   276â†’build-declarations@agent() {
   277â†’    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   278â†’        names=("${argc_agents[@]}" )
   279â†’    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
   280â†’        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
   281â†’    fi
   282â†’    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
   283â†’        _die "error: no agents provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some agents."
   284â†’    fi
   285â†’    not_found_agents=()
   286â†’    build_failed_agents=()
   287â†’    exist_tools="$(ls -1 tools)"
   288â†’    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
   289â†’        agent_dir="agents/$name"
   290â†’        declarations_file="$agent_dir/functions.json"
   291â†’        tool_names_file="$agent_dir/tools.txt"
   292â†’        found=false
   293â†’        if [[ -d "$agent_dir" ]]; then
   294â†’            found=true
   295â†’            ok=true
   296â†’            json_data=""
   297â†’            agent_json_data=""
   298â†’            tools_json_data=""
   299â†’            for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
   300â†’                lang="${item%:*}"
   301â†’                agent_tools_path="$agent_dir/tools.$lang"
   302â†’                if [[ -f "$agent_tools_path" ]]; then
   303â†’                    agent_json_data="$(generate-declarations@agent "$name")" || {
   304â†’                        ok=false
   305â†’                        build_failed_agents+=("$name")
   306â†’                    }
   307â†’                    break
   308â†’                fi
   309â†’            done
   310â†’            if [[ -f "$tool_names_file" ]]; then
   311â†’                if grep -q '^web_search\.' "$tool_names_file" && ! grep -q '^web_search\.' <<<"$exist_tools"; then
   312â†’                    echo "WARNING: no found web_search tool, please run \`argc link-web-search <web-search-tool>\` to set one."
   313â†’                fi
   314â†’                if grep -q '^code_interpreter\.' "$tool_names_file" && ! grep -q '^code_interpreter\.' <<<"$exist_tools"; then
   315â†’                    echo "WARNING: no found code_interpreter tool, please run \`argc link-code-interpreter <execute-code-tool>\` to set one."
   316â†’                fi
   317â†’                tools_json_data="$(argc build-declarations@tool --names-file="$tool_names_file" --declarations-file=-)" || {
   318â†’                    ok=false
   319â†’                    build_failed_agents+=("$name")
   320â†’                }
   321â†’            fi
   322â†’            if [[ "$ok" == "true" ]]; then
   323â†’                if [[ -n "$agent_json_data" ]] && [[ -n "$tools_json_data" ]]; then
   324â†’                    json_data="$(echo "[$agent_json_data,$tools_json_data]" | jq 'flatten')"
   325â†’                elif [[ -n "$agent_json_data" ]]; then
   326â†’                    json_data="$agent_json_data"
   327â†’                elif [[ -n "$tools_json_data" ]]; then
   328â†’                    json_data="$tools_json_data"
   329â†’                fi
   330â†’                if [[ -n "$json_data" ]]; then
   331â†’                    echo "Build $declarations_file"
   332â†’                    echo "$json_data" > "$declarations_file"
   333â†’                fi
   334â†’            fi
   335â†’        fi
   336â†’        if [[ "$found" == "false" ]]; then
   337â†’            not_found_agents+=("$name")
   338â†’        fi
   339â†’    done
   340â†’    if [[ -n "$not_found_agents" ]]; then
   341â†’        _die "error: not found agents: ${not_found_agents[*]}"
   342â†’    fi
   343â†’    if [[ -n "$build_failed_agents" ]]; then
   344â†’        _die "error: invalid agents: ${build_failed_agents[*]}"
   345â†’    fi
   346â†’}
   347â†’
   348â†’# @cmd Generate function declarations for the agent
   349â†’# @alias agent:generate-declarations
   350â†’# @flag --oneline Summary JSON in one line
   351â†’# @arg agent![`_choice_agent`] The agent name
   352â†’generate-declarations@agent() {
   353â†’    tools_path="$(_get_agent_tools_path "$1")"
   354â†’    if [[ -z "$tools_path" ]]; then
   355â†’        _die "error: no found entry file at agents/$1/tools.<lang>"
   356â†’    fi
   357â†’    lang="${tools_path##*.}"
   358â†’    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
   359â†’    json="$("$cmd" "scripts/build-declarations.$lang" "$tools_path" | jq 'map(. + {agent: true})')"
   360â†’    if [[ -n "$argc_oneline" ]]; then
   361â†’        echo "$json" | jq -r '.[] | .name + ": " + (.description | split("\n"))[0]'
   362â†’    else
   363â†’        echo "$json"
   364â†’    fi
   365â†’}

   374â†’# @cmd Check dependencies and environment variables for a specific tool
   375â†’# @alias tool:check
   376â†’# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool name
   377â†’check@tool() {
   378â†’    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   379â†’        tool_names=("${argc_tools[@]}")
   380â†’    else
   381â†’        tool_names=($(cat tools.txt | grep -v '^#'))
   382â†’    fi
   383â†’    for name in "${tool_names[@]}"; do
   384â†’        tool_path="tools/$name"
   385â†’        echo "Check $tool_path"
   386â†’        if [[ -f "$tool_path" ]]; then
   387â†’            _check_bin "${name%.*}"
   388â†’            _check_envs "$tool_path"
   389â†’            ./scripts/check-deps.sh "$tool_path"
   390â†’        else
   391â†’            echo "âœ— not found tool file"
   392â†’        fi
   393â†’    done
   394â†’}

   396â†’# @cmd Check dependencies and environment variables for a specific agent
   397â†’# @alias agent:check
   398â†’# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The agent name
   399â†’check@agent() {
   400â†’    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
   401â†’        agent_names=("${argc_agents[@]}")
   402â†’    else
   403â†’        agent_names=($(cat agents.txt | grep -v '^#'))
   404â†’    fi
   405â†’    for name in "${agent_names[@]}"; do
   406â†’        agent_dir="agents/$name"
   407â†’        echo "Check $agent_dir"
   408â†’        if [[ -d "$agent_dir" ]]; then
   409â†’            for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
   410â†’                lang="${item%:*}"
   411â†’                agent_tools_path="$agent_dir/tools.$lang"
   412â†’                if [[ -f "$agent_tools_path" ]]; then
   413â†’                    _check_bin "$name"
   414â†’                    _check_envs "$agent_tools_path"
   415â†’                    ./scripts/check-deps.sh "$agent_tools_path"
   416â†’                    break
   417â†’                fi
   418â†’            done
   419â†’        else
   420â†’            echo "âœ— not found agent dir"
   421â†’        fi
   422â†’    done
   423â†’}

   555â†’# @cmd Link this repo to aichat functions_dir
   556â†’link-to-aichat() {
   557â†’    functions_dir="$(aichat --info | grep -w functions_dir | awk '{$1=""; print substr($0,2)}')"
   558â†’    if [[ -z "$functions_dir" ]]; then
   559â†’        _die "error: your aichat version don't support function calling"
   560â†’    fi
   561â†’    if [[ ! -e "$functions_dir" ]]; then
   562â†’        if _is_win; then
   563â†’            current_dir="$(cygpath -w "$(pwd)")"
   564â†’            cmd <<< "mklink /D \"${functions_dir%/}\" \"${current_dir%/}\"" > /dev/null
   565â†’        else
   566â†’            ln -s "$(pwd)" "$functions_dir"
   567â†’        fi
   568â†’        echo "$functions_dir symlinked"
   569â†’    else
   570â†’        echo "$functions_dir already exists"
   571â†’    fi
   572â†’}

   587â†’# @cmd Displays version information for required tools
   588â†’version() {
   589â†’    uname -a
   590â†’    if command -v aichat &> /dev/null; then
   591â†’        aichat --version
   592â†’    fi
   593â†’    argc --argc-version
   594â†’    jq --version
   595â†’    ls --version 2>&1 | head -n 1
   596â†’    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
   597â†’        cmd="${item#*:}"
   598â†’        if [[ "$cmd" == "bash" ]]; then
   599â†’            echo "$(argc --argc-shell-path) $("$(argc --argc-shell-path)" --version | head -n 1)"
   600â†’        elif command -v "$cmd" &> /dev/null; then
   601â†’            echo "$(_normalize_path "$(which $cmd)") $($cmd --version)"
   602â†’        fi
   603â†’    done
   604â†’}
   605â†’
   606â†’_lang_to_cmd() {
   607â†’    match_lang="$1"
   608â†’    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
   609â†’        lang="${item%:*}"
   610â†’        if [[ "$lang" == "$match_lang" ]]; then
   611â†’            echo "${item#*:}"
   612â†’        fi
   613â†’    done
   614â†’}
   615â†’
   616â†’_get_agent_tools_path() {
   617â†’    name="$1"
   618â†’    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
   619â†’        lang="${item%:*}"
   620â†’        entry_file="agents/$name/tools.$lang"
   621â†’        if [[ -f "agents/$name/tools.$lang" ]]; then
   622â†’            echo "$entry_file"
   623â†’            break
   624â†’        fi
   625â†’    done
   626â†’}
   627â†’
   628â†’_build_win_shim() {
   629â†’    kind="$1"
   630â†’    lang="$2"
   631â†’    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
   632â†’    if [[ "$lang" == "sh" ]]; then
   633â†’        run="\"$(argc --argc-shell-path)\" --noprofile --norc"
   634â†’    else
   635â†’        if [[ "$cmd" == "python" && -d "$VENV_DIR" ]]; then
   636â†’            run="call \"$(_normalize_path "$PWD/$VENV_DIR/Scripts/activate.bat")\" && python"
   637â†’        else
   638â†’            run="\"$(_normalize_path "$(which $cmd)")\""
   639â†’        fi
   640â†’    fi
   641â†’    cat <<-EOF
   642â†’@echo off
   643â†’setlocal
   644â†’
   645â†’set "bin_dir=%~dp0"
   646â†’for %%i in ("%bin_dir:~0,-1%") do set "script_dir=%%~dpi"
   647â†’set "script_name=%~n0"
   648â†’
   649â†’$run "%script_dir%scripts\run-$kind.$lang" "%script_name%" %*
   650â†’EOF
   651â†’}
   652â†’
   653â†’_build_py_shim() {
   654â†’    kind="$1"
   655â†’    lang="$2"
   656â†’    cat <<-'EOF' | sed -e "s|__ROOT_DIR__|$PWD|g" -e "s|__VENV_DIR__|$VENV_DIR|g" -e "s/__KIND__/$kind/g"
   657â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
   658â†’set -e
   659â†’
   660â†’if [[ -f "__ROOT_DIR__/__VENV_DIR__/bin/activate" ]]; then
   661â†’    source "__ROOT_DIR__/__VENV_DIR__/bin/activate"
   662â†’fi
   663â†’
   664â†’python "__ROOT_DIR__/scripts/run-__KIND__.py" "$(basename "$0")" "$@"
   665â†’EOF
   666â†’}
   667â†’
   668â†’_check_bin() {
   669â†’    bin_name="$1"
   670â†’    if _is_win; then
   671â†’        bin_name+=".cmd"
   672â†’    fi
   673â†’    if [[ ! -f "$BIN_DIR/$bin_name" ]]; then
   674â†’        echo "âœ— missing bin/$bin_name"
   675â†’    fi
   676â†’}
   677â†’
   678â†’_check_envs() {
   679â†’    script_path="$1"
   680â†’    envs=( $(sed -E -n 's/.* @env ([A-Z0-9_]+)!.*/\1/p' $script_path) )
   681â†’    missing_envs=()
   682â†’    for env in $envs; do
   683â†’        if [[ -z "${!env}" ]]; then
   684â†’            missing_envs+=("$env")
   685â†’        fi
   686â†’    done
   687â†’    if [[ -n "$missing_envs" ]]; then
   688â†’        echo "âœ— missing envs ${missing_envs[*]}"
   689â†’    fi
   690â†’}
   691â†’
   692â†’_link_tool() {
   693â†’    from="$1"
   694â†’    to="$2.${1##*.}"
   695â†’    rm -rf tools/$to
   696â†’    if _is_win; then
   697â†’        (cd tools && cp -f $from $to)
   698â†’    else
   699â†’        (cd tools && ln -s $from $to)
   700â†’    fi
   701â†’    (cd tools && ls -l $to)
   702â†’}
   703â†’
   704â†’_ask_json_data() {
   705â†’    declaration="$1"
   706â†’    echo 'Missing the JSON data but here are its properties:'
   707â†’    echo "$declaration" | ./scripts/declarations-util.sh pretty-print | sed -n '2,$s/^/>/p'
   708â†’    echo 'Generate placeholder data:'
   709â†’    data="$(echo "$declaration" | _declarations_json_data)"
   710â†’    echo ">  $data"
   711â†’    read -e -r -p 'JSON data (Press ENTER to use placeholder): ' res
   712â†’    if [[ -z "$res" ]]; then
   713â†’        argc_json="$data"
   714â†’    else
   715â†’        argc_json="$res"
   716â†’    fi
   717â†’}
   718â†’
   719â†’_declarations_json_data() {
   720â†’   ./scripts/declarations-util.sh generate-json | tail -n +2
   721â†’}
   722â†’
   723â†’_normalize_path() {

   725â†’        cygpath -w "$1"
   726â†’    else
   727â†’        echo "$1"
   728â†’    fi

   731â†’_is_win() {

   738â†’
   739â†’_argc_before() {

   742â†’    fi

   744â†’
   745â†’_choice_tool() {

   749â†’        if command -v "$cmd" &> /dev/null; then

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -e

# @meta dotenv

BIN_DIR=bin
TMP_DIR="cache/__tmp__"
VENV_DIR=".venv"

LANG_CMDS=( \
    "sh:bash" \
    "js:node" \
    "py:python" \
)

# @cmd Run the tool
# @option -C --cwd <dir> Change the current working directory
# @alias tool:run
# @arg tool![`_choice_tool`] The tool name
# @arg json The json data
run@tool() {
    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
        declaration="$(generate-declarations@tool "$argc_tool" | jq -r '.[0]')"
        if [[ -n "$declaration" ]]; then
            _ask_json_data "$declaration"
        fi
    fi
    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
        _die "error: no JSON data"
    fi
    lang="${argc_tool##*.}"
    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    run_tool_script="scripts/run-tool.$lang"
    [[ -n "$argc_cwd" ]] && cd "$argc_cwd"
    exec "$cmd" "$run_tool_script" "$argc_tool" "$argc_json"
}

# @cmd Run the agent
# @alias agent:run
# @option -C --cwd <dir> Change the current working directory
# @arg agent![`_choice_agent`] The agent name
# @arg action![?`_choice_agent_action`] The agent action
# @arg json The json data
run@agent() {
    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
        declaration="$(generate-declarations@agent "$argc_agent" | jq --arg name "$argc_action" '.[] | select(.name == $name)')"
        if [[ -n "$declaration" ]]; then
            _ask_json_data "$declaration"
        fi
    fi
    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
        _die "error: no JSON data"
    fi
    tools_path="$(_get_agent_tools_path "$argc_agent")"
    lang="${tools_path##*.}"
    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    run_agent_script="scripts/run-agent.$lang"
    [[ -n "$argc_cwd" ]] && cd "$argc_cwd"
    exec "$cmd" "$run_agent_script"  "$argc_agent" "$argc_action" "$argc_json"
}

# @cmd Build the project
build() {
    if [[ -f tools.txt ]]; then
        argc build@tool
    else
        echo 'Skipped building tools since tools.txt is missing'
    fi
    if [[ -f agents.txt ]]; then
        argc build@agent
    else
        echo 'Skipped building agents since agents.txt is missing'
    fi
    if [[ -f mcp.json ]]; then
        argc mcp merge-functions -S
    fi
}

# @cmd Build tools
# @alias tool:build
# @option --names-file=tools.txt Path to a file containing tool filenames, one per line.
# This file specifies which tools will be used.
# @option --declarations-file=functions.json <FILE> Path to a json file to save function declarations
# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool filenames
build@tool() {
    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
        argc_names_file="$TMP_DIR/tools.txt"
        printf "%s\n" "${argc_tools[@]}" > "$argc_names_file"
    elif [[ "$argc_declarations_file" == "functions.json" ]]; then
        argc clean@tool
    fi
    argc build-declarations@tool --names-file "${argc_names_file}" --declarations-file "${argc_declarations_file}"
    argc build-bin@tool --names-file "${argc_names_file}"
}

# @cmd Build tools to bin
# @alias tool:build-bin
# @option --names-file=tools.txt Path to a file containing tool filenames, one per line.
# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool filenames
build-bin@tool() {
    mkdir -p "$BIN_DIR"
    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        names=("${argc_tools[@]}" )
    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
        if [[ "${#names[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
            (cd "$BIN_DIR" && rm -rf "${names[@]}")
        fi
    fi
    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
        _die "error: no tools provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some tools."
    fi
    not_found_tools=()
    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
        basename="${name%.*}"
        lang="${name##*.}"
        tool_path="tools/$name"
        if [[  -f "$tool_path" ]]; then
            if _is_win; then
                bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$basename.cmd"
                _build_win_shim tool $lang > "$bin_file"
            else
                bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$basename"
                if [[ "$lang" == "py" && -d "$VENV_DIR" ]]; then
                    rm -rf "$bin_file"
                    _build_py_shim tool $lang > "$bin_file"
                    chmod +x "$bin_file"
                else
                    ln -s -f "$PWD/scripts/run-tool.$lang" "$bin_file"
                fi
            fi
            echo "Build bin/$basename"
        else
            not_found_tools+=("$name")
        fi
    done
    if [[ -n "$not_found_tools" ]]; then
        _die "error: not found tools: ${not_found_tools[*]}"
    fi
}

# @cmd Build tools function declarations file
# @alias tool:build-declarations
# @option --names-file=tools.txt Path to a file containing tool filenames, one per line.
# @option --declarations-file=functions.json <FILE> Path to a json file to save function declarations
# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool filenames
build-declarations@tool() {
    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        names=("${argc_tools[@]}" )
    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
    fi
    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
        _die "error: no tools provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some tools."
    fi
    json_list=()
    not_found_tools=()
    build_failed_tools=()
    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
        lang="${name##*.}"
        tool_path="tools/$name"
        if [[ ! -f "$tool_path" ]]; then
            not_found_tools+=("$name")
            continue;
        fi
        json_data="$(generate-declarations@tool "$name" | jq -r '.[0]')" || {
            build_failed_tools+=("$name")
        }
        if [[ "$json_data" == "null" ]]; then
            _die "error: failed to build declarations for tool $name"
        fi
        json_list+=("$json_data")
    done
    if [[ -n "$not_found_tools" ]]; then
        _die "error: not found tools: ${not_found_tools[*]}"
    fi
    if [[ -n "$build_failed_tools" ]]; then
        _die "error: invalid tools: ${build_failed_tools[*]}"
    fi
    json_data="$(echo "${json_list[@]}" | jq -s '.')"
    if [[ "$argc_declarations_file" == "-" ]]; then
        echo "$json_data"
    else
        echo "Build $argc_declarations_file"
        echo "$json_data" > "$argc_declarations_file"
    fi
}


# @cmd Generate function declaration for the tool
# @alias tool:generate-declarations
# @arg tool![`_choice_tool`] The tool name
generate-declarations@tool() {
    lang="${1##*.}"
    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    "$cmd" "scripts/build-declarations.$lang" "tools/$1"
}

# @cmd Build agents
# @alias agent:build
# @option --names-file=agents.txt Path to a file containing agent filenames, one per line.
# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The agent filenames
build@agent() {
    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
        argc_names_file="$TMP_DIR/agents.txt"
        printf "%s\n" "${argc_agents[@]}" > "$argc_names_file"
    else
        argc clean@agent
    fi
    argc build-declarations@agent --names-file "${argc_names_file}"
    argc build-bin@agent --names-file "${argc_names_file}"
}

# @cmd Build agents to bin
# @alias agent:build-bin
# @option --names-file=agents.txt Path to a file containing agent dirs, one per line.
# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The agent names
build-bin@agent() {
    mkdir -p "$BIN_DIR"
    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        names=("${argc_agents[@]}" )
    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
        if [[ "${#names[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
            (cd "$BIN_DIR" && rm -rf "${names[@]}")
        fi
    fi
    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
        _die "error: no agents provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some agents."
    fi
    not_found_agents=()
    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
        agent_dir="agents/$name"
        found=false
        for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
            lang="${item%:*}"
            agent_tools_path="$agent_dir/tools.$lang"
            if [[ -f "$agent_tools_path" ]]; then
                found=true
                if _is_win; then
                    bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$name.cmd"
                    _build_win_shim agent $lang > "$bin_file"
                else
                    bin_file="$BIN_DIR/$name"
                    if [[ "$lang" == "py" && -d "$VENV_DIR" ]]; then
                        rm -rf "$bin_file"
                        _build_py_shim tool $lang > "$bin_file"
                        chmod +x "$bin_file"
                    else
                        ln -s -f "$PWD/scripts/run-agent.$lang" "$bin_file"
                    fi
                fi
                echo "Build bin/$name"
                tool_names_file="$agent_dir/tools.txt"
                if [[ -f "$tool_names_file" ]]; then
                    argc build-bin@tool --names-file "${tool_names_file}"
                fi
                break
            fi
        done
        if [[ "$found" == "false" ]] && [[ ! -d "$agent_dir"  ]]; then
            not_found_agents+=("$name")
        fi
    done
    if [[ -n "$not_found_agents" ]]; then
        _die "error: not found agents: ${not_found_agents[*]}"
    fi
}

# @cmd Build agents function declarations file
# @alias agent:build-declarations
# @option --names-file=agents.txt Path to a file containing agent dirs, one per line.
# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The tool filenames
build-declarations@agent() {
    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        names=("${argc_agents[@]}" )
    elif [[ -f "$argc_names_file" ]]; then
        names=($(cat "$argc_names_file" | grep -v '^#'))
    fi
    if [[ -z "$names" ]]; then
        _die "error: no agents provided. '$argc_names_file' is missing. please create it and add some agents."
    fi
    not_found_agents=()
    build_failed_agents=()
    exist_tools="$(ls -1 tools)"
    for name in "${names[@]}"; do
        agent_dir="agents/$name"
        declarations_file="$agent_dir/functions.json"
        tool_names_file="$agent_dir/tools.txt"
        found=false
        if [[ -d "$agent_dir" ]]; then
            found=true
            ok=true
            json_data=""
            agent_json_data=""
            tools_json_data=""
            for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
                lang="${item%:*}"
                agent_tools_path="$agent_dir/tools.$lang"
                if [[ -f "$agent_tools_path" ]]; then
                    agent_json_data="$(generate-declarations@agent "$name")" || {
                        ok=false
                        build_failed_agents+=("$name")
                    }
                    break
                fi
            done
            if [[ -f "$tool_names_file" ]]; then
                if grep -q '^web_search\.' "$tool_names_file" && ! grep -q '^web_search\.' <<<"$exist_tools"; then
                    echo "WARNING: no found web_search tool, please run \`argc link-web-search <web-search-tool>\` to set one."
                fi
                if grep -q '^code_interpreter\.' "$tool_names_file" && ! grep -q '^code_interpreter\.' <<<"$exist_tools"; then
                    echo "WARNING: no found code_interpreter tool, please run \`argc link-code-interpreter <execute-code-tool>\` to set one."
                fi
                tools_json_data="$(argc build-declarations@tool --names-file="$tool_names_file" --declarations-file=-)" || {
                    ok=false
                    build_failed_agents+=("$name")
                }
            fi
            if [[ "$ok" == "true" ]]; then
                if [[ -n "$agent_json_data" ]] && [[ -n "$tools_json_data" ]]; then
                    json_data="$(echo "[$agent_json_data,$tools_json_data]" | jq 'flatten')"
                elif [[ -n "$agent_json_data" ]]; then
                    json_data="$agent_json_data"
                elif [[ -n "$tools_json_data" ]]; then
                    json_data="$tools_json_data"
                fi
                if [[ -n "$json_data" ]]; then
                    echo "Build $declarations_file"
                    echo "$json_data" > "$declarations_file"
                fi
            fi
        fi
        if [[ "$found" == "false" ]]; then
            not_found_agents+=("$name")
        fi
    done
    if [[ -n "$not_found_agents" ]]; then
        _die "error: not found agents: ${not_found_agents[*]}"
    fi
    if [[ -n "$build_failed_agents" ]]; then
        _die "error: invalid agents: ${build_failed_agents[*]}"
    fi
}

# @cmd Generate function declarations for the agent
# @alias agent:generate-declarations
# @flag --oneline Summary JSON in one line
# @arg agent![`_choice_agent`] The agent name
generate-declarations@agent() {
    tools_path="$(_get_agent_tools_path "$1")"
    if [[ -z "$tools_path" ]]; then
        _die "error: no found entry file at agents/$1/tools.<lang>"
    fi
    lang="${tools_path##*.}"
    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    json="$("$cmd" "scripts/build-declarations.$lang" "$tools_path" | jq 'map(. + {agent: true})')"
    if [[ -n "$argc_oneline" ]]; then
        echo "$json" | jq -r '.[] | .name + ": " + (.description | split("\n"))[0]'
    else
        echo "$json"
    fi
}

# @cmd Check environment variables, Node/Python dependencies, MCP-Bridge-Server status
check() {
    argc check@tool
    argc check@agent
    argc mcp check
}

# @cmd Check dependencies and environment variables for a specific tool
# @alias tool:check
# @arg tools*[`_choice_tool`] The tool name
check@tool() {
    if [[ "${#argc_tools[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        tool_names=("${argc_tools[@]}")
    else
        tool_names=($(cat tools.txt | grep -v '^#'))
    fi
    for name in "${tool_names[@]}"; do
        tool_path="tools/$name"
        echo "Check $tool_path"
        if [[ -f "$tool_path" ]]; then
            _check_bin "${name%.*}"
            _check_envs "$tool_path"
            ./scripts/check-deps.sh "$tool_path"
        else
            echo "âœ— not found tool file"
        fi
    done
}

# @cmd Check dependencies and environment variables for a specific agent
# @alias agent:check
# @arg agents*[`_choice_agent`] The agent name
check@agent() {
    if [[ "${#argc_agents[@]}" -gt 0 ]]; then
        agent_names=("${argc_agents[@]}")
    else
        agent_names=($(cat agents.txt | grep -v '^#'))
    fi
    for name in "${agent_names[@]}"; do
        agent_dir="agents/$name"
        echo "Check $agent_dir"
        if [[ -d "$agent_dir" ]]; then
            for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
                lang="${item%:*}"
                agent_tools_path="$agent_dir/tools.$lang"
                if [[ -f "$agent_tools_path" ]]; then
                    _check_bin "$name"
                    _check_envs "$agent_tools_path"
                    ./scripts/check-deps.sh "$agent_tools_path"
                    break
                fi
            done
        else
            echo "âœ— not found agent dir"
        fi
    done
}

# @cmd List tools which can be put into functions.txt
# @alias tool:list
# Examples:
#      argc list-tools > tools.txt
list@tool() {
    _choice_tool
}

# @cmd List agents which can be put into agents.txt
# @alias agent:list
# Examples:
#      argc list-agents > agents.txt
list@agent() {
    _choice_agent
}

# @cmd Test the project
test() {
    test@tool
    test@agent
}

# @cmd Test tools
# @alias tool:test
test@tool() {
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    names_file="$TMP_DIR/tools.txt"
    declarations_file="$TMP_DIR/functions.json"
    argc list@tool > "$names_file"
    argc build@tool --names-file "$names_file" --declarations-file "$declarations_file"
    test-demo@tool
}

# @cmd Test demo tools
# @alias tool:test-demo
test-demo@tool() {
    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
        lang="${item%:*}"
        tool="demo_$lang.$lang"
        echo "---- Test $tool ---"
        argc build-bin@tool "$tool"
        argc run@tool $tool '{
     "boolean": true,
     "string": "Hello",
     "string_enum": "foo",
     "integer": 123,
     "number": 3.14,
     "array": [
          "a",
          "b",
          "c"
     ],
     "string_optional": "OptionalValue",
     "array_optional": [
          "x",
          "y"
     ]
}'
        echo
    done
}

# @cmd Test agents
# @alias agent:test
test@agent() {
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    names_file="$TMP_DIR/agents.txt"
    argc list@agent > "$names_file"
    argc build@agent --names-file "$names_file"
    test-demo@agent
}

# @cmd Test demo agents
# @alias agent:test-demo
test-demo@agent() {
    echo "---- Test demo agent ---"
    args=(demo get_ipinfo '{}')
    argc run@agent "${args[@]}"
    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
        cmd="${item#*:}"
        lang="${item%:*}"
        echo "---- Test agents/demo/tools.$lang ---"
        if [[ "$cmd" == "sh" ]]; then
            "$(argc --argc-shell-path)" ./scripts/run-agent.sh "${args[@]}"
        elif command -v "$cmd" &> /dev/null; then
            $cmd ./scripts/run-agent.$lang "${args[@]}"
            echo
        fi
    done
}

# @cmd Clean the project
clean() {
    clean@tool
    clean@agent
    rm -rf "$BIN_DIR/"*
}

# @cmd Clean tools
# @alias tool:clean
clean@tool() {
    _choice_tool | sed -E 's/\.([a-z]+)$//' |  xargs -I{} rm -rf "$BIN_DIR/{}"
    rm -rf functions.json
}

# @cmd Clean agents
# @alias agent:clean
clean@agent() {
    _choice_agent | xargs -I{} rm -rf "$BIN_DIR/{}"
    _choice_agent | xargs -I{} rm -rf agents/{}/functions.json
}

# @cmd Link a tool as web_search tool
#
# Example:
#   argc link-web-search web_search_perplexity.sh
# @arg tool![`_choice_web_search`]  The tool work as web_search
link-web-search() {
    _link_tool $1 web_search
}

# @cmd Link a tool as code_interpreter tool
#
# Example:
#   argc link-code-interpreter execute_py_code.py
# @arg tool![`_choice_code_interpreter`]  The tool work as code_interpreter
link-code-interpreter() {
    _link_tool $1 code_interpreter
}

# @cmd Link this repo to aichat functions_dir
link-to-aichat() {
    functions_dir="$(aichat --info | grep -w functions_dir | awk '{$1=""; print substr($0,2)}')"
    if [[ -z "$functions_dir" ]]; then
        _die "error: your aichat version don't support function calling"
    fi
    if [[ ! -e "$functions_dir" ]]; then
        if _is_win; then
            current_dir="$(cygpath -w "$(pwd)")"
            cmd <<< "mklink /D \"${functions_dir%/}\" \"${current_dir%/}\"" > /dev/null
        else
            ln -s "$(pwd)" "$functions_dir"
        fi
        echo "$functions_dir symlinked"
    else
        echo "$functions_dir already exists"
    fi
}

# @cmd Run mcp command
# @arg args~[?`_choice_mcp_args`] The mcp command and arguments
mcp() {
    bash ./scripts/mcp.sh "$@"
}

# @cmd Create a boilplate tool script
# @alias tool:create
# @arg args~
create@tool() {
    ./scripts/create-tool.sh "$@"
}

# @cmd Displays version information for required tools
version() {
    uname -a
    if command -v aichat &> /dev/null; then
        aichat --version
    fi
    argc --argc-version
    jq --version
    ls --version 2>&1 | head -n 1
    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
        cmd="${item#*:}"
        if [[ "$cmd" == "bash" ]]; then
            echo "$(argc --argc-shell-path) $("$(argc --argc-shell-path)" --version | head -n 1)"
        elif command -v "$cmd" &> /dev/null; then
            echo "$(_normalize_path "$(which $cmd)") $($cmd --version)"
        fi
    done
}

_lang_to_cmd() {
    match_lang="$1"
    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
        lang="${item%:*}"
        if [[ "$lang" == "$match_lang" ]]; then
            echo "${item#*:}"
        fi
    done
}

_get_agent_tools_path() {
    name="$1"
    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
        lang="${item%:*}"
        entry_file="agents/$name/tools.$lang"
        if [[ -f "agents/$name/tools.$lang" ]]; then
            echo "$entry_file"
            break
        fi
    done
}

_build_win_shim() {
    kind="$1"
    lang="$2"
    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    if [[ "$lang" == "sh" ]]; then
        run="\"$(argc --argc-shell-path)\" --noprofile --norc"
    else
        if [[ "$cmd" == "python" && -d "$VENV_DIR" ]]; then
            run="call \"$(_normalize_path "$PWD/$VENV_DIR/Scripts/activate.bat")\" && python"
        else
            run="\"$(_normalize_path "$(which $cmd)")\""
        fi
    fi
    cat <<-EOF
@echo off
setlocal

set "bin_dir=%~dp0"
for %%i in ("%bin_dir:~0,-1%") do set "script_dir=%%~dpi"
set "script_name=%~n0"

$run "%script_dir%scripts\run-$kind.$lang" "%script_name%" %*
EOF
}

_build_py_shim() {
    kind="$1"
    lang="$2"
    cat <<-'EOF' | sed -e "s|__ROOT_DIR__|$PWD|g" -e "s|__VENV_DIR__|$VENV_DIR|g" -e "s/__KIND__/$kind/g"
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -e

if [[ -f "__ROOT_DIR__/__VENV_DIR__/bin/activate" ]]; then
    source "__ROOT_DIR__/__VENV_DIR__/bin/activate"
fi

python "__ROOT_DIR__/scripts/run-__KIND__.py" "$(basename "$0")" "$@"
EOF
}

_check_bin() {
    bin_name="$1"
    if _is_win; then
        bin_name+=".cmd"
    fi
    if [[ ! -f "$BIN_DIR/$bin_name" ]]; then
        echo "âœ— missing bin/$bin_name"
    fi
}

_check_envs() {
    script_path="$1"
    envs=( $(sed -E -n 's/.* @env ([A-Z0-9_]+)!.*/\1/p' $script_path) )
    missing_envs=()
    for env in $envs; do
        if [[ -z "${!env}" ]]; then
            missing_envs+=("$env")
        fi
    done
    if [[ -n "$missing_envs" ]]; then
        echo "âœ— missing envs ${missing_envs[*]}"
    fi
}

_link_tool() {
    from="$1"
    to="$2.${1##*.}"
    rm -rf tools/$to
    if _is_win; then
        (cd tools && cp -f $from $to)
    else
        (cd tools && ln -s $from $to)
    fi
    (cd tools && ls -l $to)
}

_ask_json_data() {
    declaration="$1"
    echo 'Missing the JSON data but here are its properties:'
    echo "$declaration" | ./scripts/declarations-util.sh pretty-print | sed -n '2,$s/^/>/p'
    echo 'Generate placeholder data:'
    data="$(echo "$declaration" | _declarations_json_data)"
    echo ">  $data"
    read -e -r -p 'JSON data (Press ENTER to use placeholder): ' res
    if [[ -z "$res" ]]; then
        argc_json="$data"
    else
        argc_json="$res"
    fi
}

_declarations_json_data() {
   ./scripts/declarations-util.sh generate-json | tail -n +2
}

_normalize_path() {
    if _is_win; then
        cygpath -w "$1"
    else
        echo "$1"
    fi
}

_is_win() {
    if [[ "$OS" == "Windows_NT" ]]; then
        return 0
    else
        return 1
    fi
}

_argc_before() {
    if [[ -d ".venv/bin/activate" ]]; then
        source .venv/bin/activate
    fi
}

_choice_tool() {
    for item in "${LANG_CMDS[@]}"; do
        lang="${item%:*}"
        cmd="${item#*:}"
        if command -v "$cmd" &> /dev/null; then
            ls -1 tools | grep "\.$lang$"
        fi
    done
}

_choice_web_search() {
    _choice_tool | grep '^web_search_'
}

_choice_code_interpreter() {
    _choice_tool | grep '^execute_.*_code'
}

_choice_agent() {
    ls -1 agents
}

_choice_agent_action() {
    if [[ "$ARGC_COMPGEN" -eq 1 ]]; then
        expr="s/: /\t/"
    else
        expr="s/:.*//"
    fi
    argc generate-declarations@agent "$1" --oneline | sed "$expr"
}

_choice_mcp_args() {
    if [[ "$ARGC_COMPGEN" -eq 1 ]]; then
        args=( "${argc__positionals[@]}" )
        args[-1]="$ARGC_LAST_ARG"
        argc --argc-compgen generic scripts/mcp.sh mcp "${args[@]}"
    else
        :;
    fi
}

_die() {
    echo "$*" >&2
    exit 1
}

if _is_win; then set -o igncr; fi

# See more details at https://github.com/sigoden/argc
eval "$(argc --argc-eval "$0" "$@")"

**\"$\"**: to define or reference something\n    - \"the definition of definition is the definition\"\n- **1 dimension**:\n  - **\"$x\"**: `$x`\n    - \"x is x\", \"x is a reference to x\", \"the definition of ID is ID is ID\"\n  - **\"$id\"**: `$id`,`$a`\n    - \"a reference to yourself is yourself\", \"you are because you are\"\n    - !!! \"DEFINING SOMETHING FROM WHAT YOU HAVE, BEING, VALUE, STACK, IMPLEMENTATION, INSTANTIATED, EXISTING, MEASURABLE, PLUS, YIN, ACTUALLY EXISTING, YADDAYADDA\" !!!\n    - **0 dimension**:\n      - **\"=\"**: `$id=$id`\n        - \"A thing is exactly that\"\n      - **\"!=\"**: `$a!=$b`\n      - **\"[]\"**: `[$id=$id]`\n        - \"A thing is exactly a thing\"\n      - **\"{}\"**: `{$id=$id}`\n        - \"Saying something is a thing does not make it the thing\"\n    - **1 dimension**:\n      - **\"@\"**: `{$id=$id}@[$id=$id]`\n    - !!! \"DEFINING SOMETHING FROM WHAT YOU ARE MISSING, DIFFERENCE, NOT BEING EQUAL, TRANSFORMATION, UNMEASURABLE, STATIC, NOT FULFILLED, HEAP, ABSTRACT, MINUS, NOT REAL\" !!!\n    - **0.1? dimensions**:\n      - **\"[]\"**: `[$id=$id]`\n        - \"likeness, to be the same, identical\"\n      - **\"{}\"**: `{id=$id}`\n        - \"to not be the same\"\n  - **\"@\"**: do something to nothing\n    - \"void, no return, side-effect\"\n  - **\"$\"**: reference something without being anything\n    - \"null, null-pointer\"\n\n---\n\n- **- dimension**:\n  - **\"@$\"**: `[=]`\n    - \"ID is ID is ID\", \"no transformation allowed\"\n  - **\"$@\"**: `[!=]`\n- **2 dimensions**:\n  - **\"@action$type\"**\n  - **\"@\"**: to act upon something is just\n\n---\n\nTypes: `($@)` / Transformations: `(@$)` / Functions: `($@=@$)`, linked list, arrays: `($$)` and abstractions: `($$)`\n\n---\n\n\u03a0-types (product types *)\n\u03a3-types (sum types |)\nidentity types (=)\npath types (->)\n\nmaybe not needed but for good measure might include these as well\n\n_ as polymorphic existentials (\u2203x.P(x))\n@ as modal necessity (\u25a1) from modal logic\n: as type judgement (\u0393 \u22a2 a : A)\n\ncreating a free cartesian closed category is obvious\n\n* = product\n-> = exponential object\n| = coproduct\n@ = monadic binding\n\nand yeah - might as well\n\n_ as polymorphic yoneda embedding\n. as forgetful functor\n= as natural isomorphism\n\nlinear types ($unique), the effect system (@), regular persistent data structures ($eid with it's versioning) and security via capability (.) is old news\n\ntype universe would be self referential via $ containing $ or dependencies/dependent types such as $message.created_at$datetime\n\n---\n\nthe _ operator:\n  heideggerian being-in-the-world (dasein)\n  badiouian event theory (@ as evental site)\n  deleuzian difference engine ({_} as differance)\nbut operationalized computationally through:\n  $entity.gen as bergsonian duration\n  $list as husserlian time consciousness\n  $unique as leibnizian identity\n\ndata $type : type where\n  ($) : $type -> $type\n  (*) : $type -> $type -> $type\n  (|) : $type -> $type -> $type\n  (@) : $type -> $type -> $type\n  (=) : $type -> $type -> $type\n\ng\u00f6del numbering:\n\u03c6($) = 1\n\u03c6(|) = 2\n\u03c6(_) = 3\netc...\n\noverall trying to avoid inconsistency via:\n  predicative hierarchy (no $ in its own definition)\n  type/token distinction (id vs unique)\n  bounded generality (list as finite ordinal)\n\nlucky to be born early:\nMartin-L\u00f6f Type Theory (1972)\nFitch-Style Calculi (1952)\nLawvere Theories (1963)\n\n(don't see any _ for existance, $eid representing spacetime coordinates or even basic semiotics like using @ as a pragmatic force? ;)) ",
   287â†’    "not-a-poet": "im not much of a poet\n\ni like strictly typed languages with my syntax well defined\n\nI despise uncertainty and feel uneasy when making assumptions\n\nim more of a programmer kind of guy\n\ni want to know what things really are and be able to define it down to its atomic parts and describe the world around my in a way where reason and logic is my building blocks\n\nthe dreamers can keep their fantasy worlds because at least i know precisely what i have without making it up\n\nit might not be as beautiful or expressive - but least I fully understand it fully\n\ni'm a programmer because i lack the things i pretend to have\n\nand we have a lot\n\n\n\noop - references playing dress-up\nfp - transformations seeking completion\ntypes - categorizing illusions while promising lies\nmemory - organizing nothingness\npolymorphism - void pretending to be nobody\nconcurrency - multiple nothings acting simultaneously\nstate - persistent illusions pretending to be real\n\nevery design pattern, every architecture, every paradigm - just a elaborate dance between what we lack and what we pretend to have\n\nthe poetic truth: we write millions of lines of code to manage our relationship with nothingness\n\nevery fizzbuzz i write is just the void creating references to nothingness to play with itself\n\ni'm composing symphonies of lack! creating emptyness via a illusion of substance so it has something to transform\n\nall of this nothingness talking to itself - kind of poetic in a way?\n\n",
